channel.title: Why Chinese video game ripoffs are a bad idea
channel.description: Hey I found this video series featuring what looks like both the worst and most frustrating game ever. [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ivtnl5SSf8A&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=26Ra6Y_f8Nk&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7X7UhnbuBRI&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bcrAt2Ln3ug&feature=related[/url] Enjoy the lols and lulz!; ) (I'm old-fashioned)

item.title: Why Chinese video game ripoffs are a bad idea
item.dc:creator: chumchum
item.description:
Ibanez:

BULLSHIT YOU LIED. As soon as I went under the spikes I fell through to another screen below and died instantly.

In the screen below keep left at first to avoid the prick that just wants to kick you, watch out as to not land on the spikes, there’s a safe island, as soon as you land on it quickly go to the next one to avoid another horrible death.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Chinese video game ripoffs are a bad idea

item.title: Why Chinese video game ripoffs are a bad idea
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
This is actually possible to beat, I’ve done it myself. there are 4 levels and there is even a good ending and a bad ending (It was hard enough to get the bad ending, so I wasn’t sure if there even WAS a good ending for certain until I checked online)

It’s more of a study into video game conventions than to deliberately annoy people. I’d call this a must play for any long time gamer, as it challenges you to not listen to your past memorized reflexes but to learn the game mechanics anew and how to use them in ways you wouldn’t normally expect.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Chinese video game ripoffs are a bad idea

Mind blowing fun

item.title: Why Chinese video game ripoffs are a bad idea
item.dc:creator: chumchum
item.description:
Spooboy:

How do you get passed the first part??

Jump on the platform to the left, then go left, and quickly head underneath the spikes without hitting the ground to the left, because that will provoke another set of spikes to fall from the sky, you can jump on top of those and climb along the chain.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Chinese video game ripoffs are a bad idea
item.dc:creator: Spooboy
item.description:
chumchum:

Hehe, anyone also tried The Life Ending Adventure, a bit similar. Z to jump, X to shoot a little ball (watch out, they bounce) and directional buttons to move…and F tu turn into a volcano? There are other simirlarly useless moves.
Clicking on start will have you play without checkpoints, so I reccomend ゆとりモ-
ド (The option beneath start) which will have generous checkpoints.

On a side note I think it’s fair to mix up Chinese and Japanese if you’ve lived in an English speaking country most of your life, also given something like one in five people on this planet are Chinese.

How do you get passed the first part??

Read full topic
item.source: Why Chinese video game ripoffs are a bad idea
